comments.body: I've added a type to the message param in the callback. I'm not sure it is correct for the done event

This method was intentionally split to true and false. When you pass false, you'll always get a callback without any arguments. When you pass true, you may get an error and/or data. Look here https://github.com/SOHU-Co/kafka-node/blob/master/lib/client.js#L363

```(error: any, data: any) => any)```
is the same as
```(error?: any, data?: any) => any)```
(those "?"s are useless as ```any``` covers ```undefined```)
and it also therefore covers
```() => any)```

So this single declaration seems equivalent to (and less "wordy" than) the three it replaced.
I think error and data should stay optional. You might get undefined for them.
